KA_Analysis.K1: Written assessments evaluate understanding of probability distributions, statistical modeling concepts, and latent variable theory through scenario-based questions.
KA_Analysis.K2: Candidates demonstrate knowledge of dataset formats and evaluation methods through structured response questions and format identification tasks.
KA_Analysis.K3: Assessment includes technical questions on fine-tuning approaches, parameter optimization, and inference processes in model development.
KA_Analysis.K4: Evaluation covers neural network optimization principles through problem-solving questions focused on training methodology and convergence concepts.
KA_Analysis.K5: Testing addresses distributed computing knowledge through questions on parallel processing architectures and cluster management principles.
KA_Analysis.K6: Assessment examines understanding of various loss functions and evaluation metrics through comparative analysis questions.
KA_Analysis.K7: Questions focus on data quality principles, cleaning methodologies, and preprocessing requirements for AI model training.
KA_Analysis.K8: Evaluation tests comprehension of embedding techniques and tokenization methods through technical analysis questions.
KA_Analysis.K9: Assessment covers deep learning architectures through detailed questions about GANs, VAEs, and transformer models.
KA_Analysis.K10: Testing examines familiarity with major ML libraries through framework-specific technical questions.
KA_Analysis.A1: Practical assessment requires implementing and configuring generative models using established architectures.
KA_Analysis.A2: Hands-on exercises involve analyzing requirements and selecting appropriate generative solutions for given scenarios.
KA_Analysis.A3: Performance evaluation through practical implementation of model training using standard benchmark datasets.
KA_Analysis.A4: Project-based assessment requiring analysis of model limitations and documented improvement proposals.
KA_Analysis.A5: Practical tasks involving data preprocessing, cleaning, and preparation using industry-standard libraries.
